title: Battle for Earls Court Exhibition Centre steps up a gear
text:
The son of one of Britain's best known property developers and a company controlled by Asia's richest man are in the final round of bidding for the site of the old Earls Court Exhibition Centre in West London.

City sources said Capital & Counties, which owns the site, recently held a board meeting to discuss whether to demerge the group into two listed companies or sell the site to a buyer willing to take on the troubled development scheme.

The board is said to have made a shortlist of firms that will enter the final stage bidding for Earls Court and it is likely to decide on whether to demerge or sell at the end of October.

Capital & Counties has seen the value of the Earls Court scheme collapse over the past five years

The shortlist includes Delancey, the investment vehicle controlled by Sir John Ritblat's son Jamie, CK Asset Holdings, controlled by Asia's richest man Li Ka-shing, and Canary Wharf Group.

Capital & Counties has seen the value of the Earls Court scheme collapse over the past five years. Reports suggest it was £600million in the summer. But sources said the recent offers came in at around £450million.

Capital & Counties declined to comment.
